title: Installation issue: openmpi-3.1.3
body:
Using `develop` from today, I am unable to install this spec `openmpi@3.1.3%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2` due to an error during the configuration phase of `openmpi`.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install openmpi@3.1.3%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2 
...
==> Building openmpi [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/scott/spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.1.3-u62a52wbetk62lgimhe4x77vqlp6ymk6/openmpi-3.1.3/configure' '--prefix=/scott/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/clang-6.0.0-1ubuntu2/openmpi-3.1.3-u62a52wbetk62lgimhe4x77vqlp6ymk6' '--enable-shared' '--with-wrapper-ldflags=' '--enable-static' '--without-pmi' '--enable-mpi-cxx' '--with-zlib=/scott/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/clang-6.0.0-1ubuntu2/zlib-1.2.11-37pzrwcovpu5wxaldr5l4eg6i255dv4h' '--without-psm' '--without-libfabric' '--without-ucx' '--without-mxm' '--without-verbs' '--without-psm2' '--without-alps' '--without-lsf' '--without-sge' '--without-slurm' '--without-tm' '--without-loadleveler' '--disable-memchecker' '--with-hwloc=/scott/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/clang-6.0.0-1ubuntu2/hwloc-1.11.11-lsiketic23rfmmwxslyzv743s6nhj7pj' '--disable-java' '--disable-mpi-java' '--without-cuda' '--enable-cxx-exceptions'

1 error found in build log:
     376    checking if C and Fortran are link compatible... yes
     377    checking to see if Fortran compiler likes the C++ exception flags... yes
     378    checking to see if mpifort compiler needs additional linker flags... none
     379    checking if Fortran compiler supports CHARACTER... yes
     380    checking size of Fortran CHARACTER... configure: WARNING: Could not determine size of CHARACTER
     381    configure: WARNING: See config.log for details
  >> 382    configure: error: Cannot continue

See build log for details:
  /scott/spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.1.3-u62a52wbetk62lgimhe4x77vqlp6ymk6/openmpi-3.1.3/spack-build.out
```

```console
    ^hwloc@1.11.11%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2~cairo~cuda~gl+libxml2~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 
        ^libpciaccess@0.13.5%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 
            ^libtool@2.4.6%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 
                ^m4@1.4.18%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2 patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,c0a408fbffb7255fcc75e26bd8edab116fc81d216bfd18b473668b7739a4158e,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 +sigsegv arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64

        ^libxml2@2.9.8%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2~python arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64

            ^automake@1.16.1%clang@6.0.0-1ubuntu2 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64
```

### Platform and user environment

```commandline
[ubuntu] spack: uname -a
Linux 02ae2cdde2be 4.4.0-141-generic #167-Ubuntu SMP Wed Dec 5 10:40:15 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
[ubuntu] spack: cat /etc/lsb-release 
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=18.04
DISTRIB_CODENAME=bionic
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS"
``` 

I don't have a `packages.yaml`, but here's my `compilers.yaml`:

```commandline
[ubuntu] spack: cat ~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml 
compilers:

    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
```

### Additional information

Having spack parse the `config.log` turned up a bunch of warnings and errors, so I'm not sure if this one is the culprit or not:

```console
     10286    configure:39917: $? = 0
     10287    configure:39927: /scott/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/gfortran  -fexceptions  conftestf.f90 conftest.o -o conftest   -L/scott/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/clang-6.0.0-1ubuntu2/zlib-1.2.11-37pzrwcovpu5wxaldr5l4eg6i255
              dv4h/lib -fexceptions  -lz
     10288    /usr/bin/ld: conftest.o: relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a PIE object; recompile with -fPIC
  >> 10289    /usr/bin/ld: final link failed: Nonrepresentable section on output
  >> 10290    collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
     10291    configure:39934: $? = 1
     10292    configure:39955: here is the Fortran program:
     10293    program fsize
```

Since I'm not sure what the actual problem could be, I'm attaching some files generated by the failed build: the install output printed to the terminal, as well as `spack-build.out`, and `config.log`.
